results.title: Effects of different antihypertensive drugs on blood pressure variability in patients with ischemic stroke.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: Among these 24 @<m>DISEASE_Cerebral_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002544 @@@ischemic stroke@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@, 12 received @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ and 12 received @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@.

results.title: Amlodipine and atorvastatin exert protective and additive effects via antiapoptotic and antiautophagic mechanisms after transient middle cerebral artery occlusion in Zucker metabolic syndrome rats.
results.text_hl: Further studies are now needed to expand these preliminary results to understand fully the mechanisms involved in the protective effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ against @<m>DISEASE_Cerebral_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002544 @@@ischemic stroke@@@.

results.title: Amlodipine lowers blood pressure without significant effect on cerebral blood flow in hypertensive patients with a history of stroke: a quantitative single photon emission computed tomography study.
results.text_hl: Twenty @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with a history of @<m>DISEASE_Cerebral_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002544 @@@ischemic stroke@@@ received @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ 2.5 or 5 mg daily for 12 weeks.

citations.NLM: Shimizu H, Tominaga T, Fujiwara S. Amlodipine lowers blood pressure without significant effect on cerebral blood flow in hypertensive patients with a history of stroke: a quantitative single photon emission computed tomography study. J Stroke Cerebrovasc Dis. 2003 Nov-Dec;12(6):266-70. PMID: 17903938

results.title: Effects of lercanidipine versus amlodipine in hypertensive patients with cerebral ischemic stroke.
results.text_hl: RESEARCH DESIGN AND METHODS: An open label, controlled, randomized, parallel-group study was conducted on 104 @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ (blood pressure [BP] >130/80 mmHg) diagnosed with @<m>DISEASE_Cerebral_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002544 @@@ischemic stroke@@@. Enrolled subjects were randomly assigned to a 4 week treatment with @CHEMICAL_lercanidipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C060343 @@@lercanidipine@@@ 20 mg/day or @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ 10 mg/day.

citations.NLM: Cao TS, Huynh VM, Tran VH. Effects of lercanidipine versus amlodipine in hypertensive patients with cerebral ischemic stroke. Curr Med Res Opin. 2015 Jan;31(1):163-70. PMID: 25425058
citations.BibTeX: @article{25425058, title={Effects of lercanidipine versus amlodipine in hypertensive patients with cerebral ischemic stroke.}, author={Cao TS and Huynh VM and Tran VH}, journal={Curr Med Res Opin}, volume={31}, number={1}, pages={163-70}}

results.title: Results of a Markov model analysis to assess the cost-effectiveness of a single tablet of fixed-dose amlodipine and atorvastatin for the primary prevention of cardiovascular disease in Korea.
results.text_hl: The administration of single-tablet fixed-dose combination @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ to all such individuals was likely to represent a cost-effective means of preventing first-onset @DISEASE_Cardiovascular_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D002318 @@@CVD@@@ (ie, @DISEASE_Coronary_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003327 @@@coronary heart disease@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Cerebral_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002544 @@@ischemic stroke@@@) in this subgroup, compared with current patterns of treatment.

citations.NLM: Liew D, Park HJ, Ko SK. Results of a Markov model analysis to assess the cost-effectiveness of a single tablet of fixed-dose amlodipine and atorvastatin for the primary prevention of cardiovascular disease in Korea. Clin Ther. 2009 Oct;31(10):2189-203; discussion 2150-1. PMID: 19922890
citations.BibTeX: @article{19922890, title={Results of a Markov model analysis to assess the cost-effectiveness of a single tablet of fixed-dose amlodipine and atorvastatin for the primary prevention of cardiovascular disease in Korea.}, author={Liew D and Park HJ and Ko SK}, journal={Clin Ther}, volume={31}, number={10}, pages={2189-203; discussion 2150-1}}

results.title: Comparison of the anti-hypertensive effects of the L/N-type calcium channel antagonist cilnidipine, and the L-type calcium channel antagonist amlodipine in hypertensive patients with cerebrovascular disease.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@ or @CHEMICAL_cilnidipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C065927 @@@cilnidipine@@@ was also administered similarly, to 30 subjects having @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ associated with a @<m>DISEASE_Cerebral_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002544 @@@cerebral infarct@@@ which occurred more than one month earlier due to @DISEASE_Intracranial_Thrombosis @DISEASE_MESH:D020767 @@@cerebral thrombosis@@@ or @DISEASE_Embolism @DISEASE_MESH:D004617 @@@embolism@@@.

citations.NLM: Takei K, Araki N, Ohkubo T, Tamura N, Yamamoto T, Furuya D, Yanagisawa CT, Shimazu K.
